title: Double Indemnity
creator_credit: Edith Head, Joseph Sistrom, Raymond Chandler, Billy Wilder, Farciot Edouart and Paramount
headline_credit: United States and United States of America, 1944
brief_description: Double Indemnity is possibly the definitive film noir. It features a sharp, literate screenplay with great dialogue, a stylish, cool and erotic mise-en-scene by director Billy Wilder, and a stunning performance by Barbara Stanwyck.
creator_credit_for_label: Edith Head, Joseph Sistrom, Raymond Chandler, Billy Wilder, Farciot Edouart and Paramount
headline_credit_for_label: United States and United States of America, 1944
description: A rich woman and a calculating insurance agent plot to kill her unsuspecting husband after he signs a double indemnity policy. Against a backdrop of distinctly Californian settings, the partners in crime plan the perfect murder to collect the insurance, which pays double if the death is accidental.
description_for_label: A rich woman and a calculating insurance agent plot to kill her unsuspecting husband after he signs a double indemnity policy. Against a backdrop of distinctly Californian settings, the partners in crime plan the perfect murder to collect the insurance, which pays double if the death is accidental.
